db:abstract.db:para: Provides classes for unit testing Qt applications and libraries.

db:article.db:para: The Qt Test module provides classes for unit testing Qt applications and libraries. All public methods are in the QTest namespace. In addition, the QSignalSpy class provides easy introspection for Qt's signals and slots, and the QAbstractItemModelTester allows for non-destructive testing of item models.

db:note.db:para: There is no binary compatibility guarantee for the Qt Test module. This means that an application that uses Qt Test is only guaranteed to work with the Qt version it was developed against. However, source compatibility is guaranteed.

db:section.db:title: Using the Module
db:section.db:para: Using a Qt module requires linking against the module library, either directly or through other dependencies. Several build tools have dedicated support for this, including CMake and qmake.

db:section.db:title: Building with CMake
db:section.db:para: Use the find_package() command to locate the needed module components in the Qt6 package:
db:section.db:programlisting: find_package(Qt6 COMPONENTS Test REQUIRED) target_link_libraries(mytarget PRIVATE Qt6::Test)
db:section.db:para: See also the Build with CMake overview.
